segments.text: Next time you watch the news, notice how the anchors exaggerate their mouth movement.
segments.speaker: SPEAKER_00

segments.text: There's a good reason for this. Their job is to speak as clearly as possible.
segments.speaker: SPEAKER_00

segments.text: And I'll show you a simple drill to help you do that too. All you need is a pen.
segments.speaker: SPEAKER_00

segments.text: Practicing this quick drill regularly will train you to be more articulate with little effort.
segments.speaker: SPEAKER_00

segments.text: Place a pen between your teeth and read a paragraph from a book out loud,
segments.speaker: SPEAKER_00

segments.text: focusing on pronouncing each sound clearly. Then read it again without the pen.
segments.speaker: SPEAKER_00

segments.text: There will be a noticeable improvement in your enunciation.
segments.speaker: SPEAKER_00

segments.text: Clearly articulating your words avoids the risk of miscommunication and lost engagement,
segments.speaker: SPEAKER_00

segments.text: and it makes it easy and pleasurable to listen to you.
segments.speaker: SPEAKER_00

segments.text: Do this regularly, and you'll reap the benefits.
segments.speaker: SPEAKER_00
